fields.description:
Open the links browser by clicking on "edit" in the property panel
search for a text string different from the text in the link
highlight the search term when it is found and the link text will change.  

It's supposed to stay the same.
fields.summary: Property Panel  links browser updates link text when search result is chosen but should not

fields.description: Pagetree does not render correctly in IE7 only.  Screenshot is attached.
fields.summary: Pagetree broken for IE7 only

fields.description:
open the property panel by clicking in a link
click "go to link" 
the link will open in a new window
fields.summary: Property panel "go to link" opens a new window instead of a new tab in ie7 & ie8

fields.description:
Click on a link in the RTE to bring up the panel.

Switch to wiki markup or preview.

The panel is still visible. It should be closed when the user changes tabs.
fields.summary: Editor Properties Panel: Switching tabs in the editor does not close the panel

fields.description:
* Enter a text such as "http://www.google.com". 
* Switch to wiki markup then back to the RTE, and this will be automatically converted to a link
* Click on the link to bring up the properties panel, and select unlink.

As soon as you roundtrip/save/preview, you get the link back.
fields.summary: Editor Properties Panel: Unlink doesn't work for external links

	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardHostValve.invoke(StandardHostValve.java:128)
	at org.apache.catalina.valves.ErrorReportValve.invoke(ErrorReportValve.java:102)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardEngineValve.invoke(StandardEngineValve.java:109)
	at org.apache.catalina.connector.CoyoteAdapter.service(CoyoteAdapter.java:293)
	at org.apache.jk.server.JkCoyoteHandler.invoke(JkCoyoteHandler.java:190)
	at org.apache.jk.common.HandlerRequest.invoke(HandlerRequest.java:291)
	at org.apache.jk.common.ChannelSocket.invoke(ChannelSocket.java:769)
	at org.apache.jk.common.ChannelSocket.processConnection(ChannelSocket.java:698)
	at org.apache.jk.common.ChannelSocket$SocketConnection.runIt(ChannelSocket.java:891)
	at org.apache.tomcat.util.threads.ThreadPool$ControlRunnable.run(ThreadPool.java:690)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:619)

        

Referer URL

https://qa-eac.atlassian.com/spaces/removespace.action?key=QA{noformat}

h2. Implementation

This should be fixed by removing the foreign key constraint:
-* remove declaration from hibernate mapping files (and the associated getAttachment() accessor which is only used by tests at the moment) 
-* write an upgrade task to drop the constraint if hibernate does not remove it automatically at the next invocation of SchemaUpdate (when the build number changes): *Please note:* dropping the constraint on a large IMAGEDETAILS table is expensive. Dropping the constraint on a ~93K row IMAGEDETAILS table takes longer than 15mins.
-* write a job that periodically scans the imagedetails table for rogue rows and removes them

Alternatively, if there is time to spare, investigate implementing cascading of the removal of an attachment to remove all dependencies (such as imagedetails)
-* it should be noted that the way we version content in Confluence by cloning the latest version will make it difficult to implement this propagation - Don and I have tried and failed


h2. Workaround
# Shut down Confluence
# Make a full database and file system backup
# Run these queries to remove the imagedetails entries (after entering your space key):
{code}create temporary table deleteset as
    SELECT id.ATTACHMENTID
    FROM SPACES s
    JOIN CONTENT c ON s.SPACEID = c.SPACEID
    JOIN ATTACHMENTS a ON c.CONTENTID = a.PAGEID
    JOIN IMAGEDETAILS id ON a.ATTACHMENTID = id.ATTACHMENTID
    WHERE s.SPACEKEY = '<your_space_key>';

delete from IMAGEDETAILS where ATTACHMENTID in (select ATTACHMENTID from deleteset);
{code}
# Restart Confluence and log in as a site admin.
# Navigate to Confluence Admin > Administration > Content Indexing and make sure Confluence isn't currently reindexing.
# Remove the space.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-19575].
  {panel}

The Confluence user hover doesn't use the AUI inline dialog at the moment, instead using custom 'AJS.contentHover' functionality.

We should change it to use the AUI inline dialog, which looks essentially the same, has a nice little arrow pointing the user link/picture and is consistent with user hover in the other products.

This could potentially be a small improvement, but would probably need a fair bit of testing. Particular edge cases I remember us identifying and fixing in the user hover:

* positioning: when it appears near the screen edge, it should float _across_ instead of down
* size: it should _expand_ to fit long status messages
* menu: it should have a drop-down menu properly positioned at the bottom, including popping the menu _upwards_ when the hover appears near the bottom of the screen
* timing: the appearance of the user hover is done with a timer which starts only when the mouse stops moving. This mimics the tooltip behaviour in browsers.
* clickable buttons: the follow/stop-following links are toggles that when clicked _do not_ close the user hover.
fields.summary: Change user hover to use AUI inline dialog

We are using Confluence for documenting our software - each version has it own space. Steps to reproduce:

In a fresh install of Confluence 3.2:
* Install Customware Scaffolding Plugin version 3.3.1 using the 'standard' plugin installer  (Scaffolding Plugin 3.3.1 is NOT compatible with Confluence 3.2)
* Browse to the 'Plugin Repository'


Expected Results:
* Scaffolding Plugin should be reported as 'Outdated'

Actual Results:
* Scaffolding Plugin is reported as 'Unknown Version'


It appears that the Plugin Repository is only pulling information for plugins that are compatible with the currently running version of Confluence.  Unfortunately, users will likely run into this issue if they upgrade Confuence as their plugins aren't automatically upgraded when they upgrade Confluence.

fields.description:
Copied from CONF-19534

This might be by design, but when a user adds individuals or groups to the Edit Space Permissions page, they are immediately granted View privileges. If a user hits the Cancel button on the page, it only resets the checkboxes. It does not revert to the original permissions state from before the operation began.

While it is easy to remove these individuals and groups after the fact, it creates a dangerous expectation when administrators are learning the interface, as they might hit the cancel button and immediately navigate away from the page before noticing that the permission changes were added.

Normally, I could even consider this part of the learning curve for Confluence administrators, but with my end-users starting to look into Personal Spaces, it is starting to become a security risk.

Would it be possible to save the Permissions configuration when an edit operation is performed, and have the Cancel button revert to that?
fields.summary: Clicking cancel on space permission page should cancel any changes

fields.description:
For large instances with thousands of LDAP users, the "Show all Users" screen or for a search term with a number of results, can take a long time to return results, blocking a thread for several minutes. This behavior is not just associated with "Manage Users" admin function. The issue exists with anywhere the User Search screen appears - this is both from Admin screens and User screens. 
A large number of queries in batches of 100s are repeatedly issued to the LDAP server for each page of the user list. It appears like for the first set, it uses 100 reads, for the second 200, for the third 300 and so on... This should be improved to reduce the need for repeated queries.

As a workaround, ensure that the "Administration->General Configuration->Append wildcards to user and group searches" property has been turned OFF to limit search to exact terms. Though this work around does not stop users from impacting system performance by manually typing wildcards into the search string.
fields.summary: Improve the queries used to fetch users via the Search Users screen to prevent Wiki threads from being blocked for long periods of time

fields.description:
In screen where daily backup path is edited, 

confluence admin -> daily backup admin -> edit

There is a button for save but no button for cancel.

This will cause confusion for the user if they have edited the path but do not want to save it.  Currently, they must click on "daily backup admin" to refresh the screen or navigate elsewhere.
fields.summary: When editing the path for daily backup, there is no "cancel" button

fields.description: The SAL plugin's pom declares different versions of some dependencies from Confluence, without reason.  Eg seraph 0.38.3.  These add to the weight of the project unnecessarily.  They aren't the versions that will be run with in actuality, so there is no reason to leave them in.
fields.summary: The sal plugin uses different dependencies from Confluence unnecessarily.

fields.description:
Confluence's root project pom declares a dependency on confluence core in its dependencyManagement section thus:

{code:xml}...
            <dependency>
                <groupId>com.atlassian.confluence</groupId>
                <artifactId>confluence</artifactId>
                <version>${project.version}</version>
                <scope>provided</scope>
            </dependency>
{code}

The provided scope may be appropriate in some places, but is not an appropriate default to be inherited by everything.  For example, the acceptance tests, which currently depend on Confluence core, need Confluence to be present in its classpath.

In IDEA 9.0.2, the provided scope leads the acceptance tests to not include Confluence in their classpath and thus fail.
fields.summary: Incorrect scope in acceptance test pom breaks IDEA 9.0.2 integration
Google Gears is no longer supported so we need to Migrate to HTML 5

fields.description: When editing or creating pages with Wiki Markup as default editor, using Internet Explorer 6 as web browser, the first line of text stays hidden. See attached images to visualize the problem.

fields.description:
When using IE7, the Toolbar in the Wiki Markup Editor will overlap the first line of text, making it invisible. The workaround is to switch to Preview or Rich Text and then back to Wiki Markup, and then you will see the first line.

Steps To Reproduce in IE7
1) Set Wiki Markup as the preferred editing mode
2) Edit a page
Expected Result: The first line of text in the page is visible below the editing toolbar
Actual Result: the first line of text is obscured by the editing toolbar.

The attached image shows a page whose first line, "This is the first line of text.", is obscured by the toolbar so that only the second line, "This is the second line of text" can be viewed.
fields.summary: In IE7, Wiki Markup Editor's Toolbar overlaps first line of text

fields.description:
This happens when we add a page.  We first noticed it when a user clicks the Title box before the editor is loaded.  That page title box becomes read only.

An easier way to replicate this:
- Add a page
- Mouse click the Title text box (the cursor should now in the text box)
- Mouse click the empty space between the "Save" and "Cancel" buttons
- The Title text box is now read only

We can replicate it on 3.0 and 3.1.2 in our environement, as well as 3.1.2 on http://confluence.atlassian.com
fields.summary: Page Title Becomes Read Only

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-19503].
  {panel}

Steps to repeat:

# As user1 with system administration privileges, but _not_ in the confluence-administrators group or confluence-users group, create a space with key 'FOO'. This leads to a space with default permissions of confluence-users with some permissions, and user1 as the administrator.
# As user2 with system administration privileges, but _not_ in the confluence-administrators group or confluence-users group, create a space with key 'FOO'. First, note that space 'FOO' does _not_ appear in the list of visible spaces for user2.

You'll receive an error stating that "You do not have permissions for this operation."

This is somewhat related to CONF-4616 and CONF-9382 in that not using the hardwired confluence-administrators or confluence-users group leads to system administrators not actually having all the rights of a confluence-administrator.
fields.summary: Unhelpful error message on creating a space with a key that already exists

fields.description: confluence-drag-and-drop-1.0.3.jar use only i18n.properties therefore messages for this plugin couldn't be localized.
fields.summary: Drag and drop plugin couldn't be localized

fields.description:
Documentation theme heading 1 and heading 2 are to similar in font size.

The class "#com-atlassian-confluence .wiki-content h1" in the splitter.css file in the Documentation theme plugin is the problem.

Change 1.7em to 1.8em.
fields.summary: Documentation Theme - h1 and h2 heading sizes too similar

fields.description:
Date format such as: 
bq. 03-Mar-10

in MS excel cannot be displayed properly in confluence using viewfile macro. When trying to view the page, the browser hangs and the page is not rendered while the Java process slowly eats up the cpu resource.

To reproduce, try to view the attached excel document in confluence useing viewxls macro.

Hi,

it would be nice to have an option for limiting the index macro to a specific page hierarchy. 

We are documenting our different systems in confluence and would like to have an index over each system.

e.g.

{index:parent=@self} or {index:parent=B systems} ...
